intro: Hymenostegia aubrevillei, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by edible, star-shaped fruits that are popular in local cuisines. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their various therapeutic properties.
